item.title: [132] Who‚Äôs gonna be the John K. of the zoomer generation?
item.description:
I‚Äôve been thinking about this xeet for a few months now. Think about it, all modern kids cartoons look like beanmouth garbage, all modern adult cartoons look like Family Guy ripoff garbage, most indie cartoons suck for a variety of reasons. It‚Äôs only a matter of time before someone steps in and makes cartoons wacky again, and it‚Äôs gonna be someone who got their start on SpongeBob or The Patrick Star Show, so place your bets now, who‚Äôs it gonna be?

Honestly for me, you know the type of animators like TrustyCranberry or Dorkymations that often work on eachothers projects, are currently in college, and have definitely heard of HorseFolder and Animator320? As soon as they graduate I predict that they‚Äôre gonna get their start on SpongeBob, if anyone‚Äôs gonna be the next John Kricfalusi it‚Äôs gonna be someone in that circle.

Original filename: Untitled58_20250608145619.png

item.title: [ 36] /ck/ Tell me the truth about cross contamination and kitchen cleanliness. I was
item.description:
/ck/ Tell me the truth about cross contamination and kitchen cleanliness. I was brought up by my dad telling me raw chicken was poison and every time you touch some you NEED to wash your hands before touching anything else. Histrionic morons on the internet will flip out if you run your sink over the knife you used to cut the chicken "THE PARTICLES IN THE AIR BROOO"
Then I watch videos of the classic chefs and its like they do not give a fuck. This pic was from Jacque Pepin roasting a chicken. He trussed his chicken then touched his butter dish, touched his pepper grinder, grabbed the handle of his pan. And I can only imagine what the Mexicans in the back of your favorite restaurant are doing with their hands.
Of course I'm not going to do something stupid like touch a raw chicken and then immediately prepare a salad, but I think the vast majority of people flipping out over cross contamination are just uninformed morons trying to act knowledgeable and the easiest thing they can do is parrot food safety rules and amplify them. Like the same morons who pretend to be gun nuts and then flip out "OMG HE PUT HIS FINGER OVER THE TRIGGER NO TRIGGER DISCIPLINE!!!"

So what's the truth /ck/? How careful are you when handling raw meats?

Original filename: Screenshot 2025-06-09 113241.png

item.title: [254] The rioting intensifies
item.description:
Mass Looting Breaks Out as LA Riots Intensify
https://www.newsweek.com/mass-looting-breaks-out-la-riots-intensify-2082622

Los Angeles police have said they are receiving reports of looting from business owners as videos emerged on social media showing a mass of people running into stores whose frontages had been broken open.

"Business owners are reporting stores are being looted in the area of 6th St. and Broadway," Los Angeles Police Department's (LAPD) Central Division posted to X. "Officers are en route to the location to investigate." The area referred to is in Downtown L.A.

Police urged all businesses and residents "to report any vandalism, damage or looting to LAPD Central Division so that it can be documented by an official police report. Please photograph all vandalism and damage prior to clean up."

Why It Matters
Over the weekend, protests in Los Angeles against immigration enforcement escalated in some areas, with isolated incidents of violence and looting. In response, President Donald Trump announced the deployment of 2,000 National Guard troops to restore order, without California Governor Gavin Newsom's consent.

Immigration remains a central pillar of Trump's second-term agenda. The president has pledged sweeping crackdowns on border security, expanded deportation operations, and an end to federal benefits for undocumented immigrants.

In addition, the administration is invoking the wartime Alien Enemies Act of 1798 to broaden deportation authority‚Äîa move that has triggered fierce backlash and mounting legal challenges.

The demonstrations mark the most intense wave of public opposition to federal immigration enforcement since Trump returned to office in January.

YouTuber BillyJohnOh captured the chaotic looting of a Jordan sneaker store during a livestream. In another video posted online separately, looters can be seen raiding a gas station's convenience store.

Original filename: Los Angeles circa 2025.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [379] Trump quells insurrection in LA
item.description:
Trump orders National Guard to LA after clashes

https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c4gkyggekgyo

US President Donald Trump has ordered 2,000 National Guardsmen to Los Angeles to deal with unrest over raids on undocumented migrants.

Trump said the federal government would "step in and solve the problem", after the Californian city saw a second day of clashes between protesters and federal agents.

Tear gas was used to disperse crowds as residents of the predominantly Latino Paramount district clashed with Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents earlier in the day.

As many as 118 arrests were made in LA this week as a result of ICE operations, including 44 on Friday. California Governor Gavin Newsom has condemned the raids as "cruel".

Trump thanked the National Guard for a "job well done" in Los Angeles late on Saturday night. Despite this, the troops did not appear to have arrived in the city.

Early on Sunday the New York Times website quoted a federal official as saying that the force would arrive within 24 hours.

Trump criticised the city's Democratic governor and mayor in a post on his Truth Social platform, calling them "incompetent". He also said protesters would no longer be allowed to wear masks.
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [124] /tug√£o/ - State of the (League of) Nation(s) Edition
item.description:
And so, once again, another edition of the Portuguese league ended and, once again, I know none of you cunts made even the slightest effort to watch it, including Portuguese posters and myself. But it's ok, because there is this image that explains what happened. You don't know the fun, memes and knowledge you're ignoring.

It was a very interesting season, with Sporting winning its first back-to-back league in 70 years, but not for lack of trying not to, since they hired what was possibily the greatest retard our league has ever seen to coach them for a month, which made the league being fought until the end. Ultimately, Benfica did not have a team as cohesive as Sporting, and now has some internal issues regarding its leadership. FC Porto collapsed, which is expected from a broke team that has no midfield, a shit defense, a weakminded striker, and a possibily autistic guna coach. Braga failed to get third place, despite old Moutinho trying to carry them. Santa Clara ended in fifth, which means they will be relegated in 2027. Jose Mota managed to save AFS... AVS... whatever that is. The saddest thing that happened was Boavista getting relegated, a relegation from which they are unbound to recover, since they have no money and couldn't get new players for most of the past seasons. Press F to pay respects to them. They and Farense will be replaced by Tondela and a returned Alverca, this time with no ties to LFV, but owned by Vinicius Jr.

So, /sp/, please give a chance to our league. Sure, we have zero quality on it, and it is getting worse but would you really rather watch meaningless games like Tottenham vs Brentford than matches that actually end up in trophies being won? Please give us a chance. You will not regret it.

Also, this sunday we play against nuestros hermanos for the Nations League final. I personally have no hopes for this, since they have a better coach and team. Watch it too, please.

Original filename: 2024-25 LEAGUE.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 62] *** PHILIPPINES TRAVEL ADVISORY THAT YOU WON'T HEAR ELSEWHERE ***
item.description:
Setting the Record Straight on the Zeitgeist of the Philippines

The Philippines is NO LONGER A TRAVEL DESTINATION FOR FINDING A WIFE (HASN'T BEEN) NOR IS IT GOOD FOR FUN.

I recently returned from a 4+ month long trip and I kept a journal of some of the events occurring there.

SOCIAL MEDIA HAS DESTROYED EVERY CORNER OF THE PHILIPPINES
without exception, every young Filipina is giving in to the temptation to ask for free money online if you try to meet them on a dating application/website. It is impossible to distinguish the really bad actors from the bad actors. They're all swapping notes about how to get the most from foreigners (and fellow Filipinos alike, they're not just doing these things to foreigners), and it has turned into a game of one-upsmanship between the girls to say how they got the most for doing the least. This is like western women going to a bar to see how many free drinks they can get.

Man-hate and feminism is FULL BORE now. I have videos of malls with huge displays up so that even the lowest IQ Filipinos can understand that women are being glorified.

I also have a video I took of just how many men women are messaging and what men are saying to them if anyone is interested in seeing it. A lot of men are simply genuinely seeking an emotional connection to a woman, however the women are happy to send you a few terse messages, letting you believe she's listening, then these dummies start sending her money for free. Some guys are offering thousands of dollars to travel for a month with her; sometimes it's multiple guys traveling with the same woman (this is disgusting, but it's happening). One big theme is that men seem to think because a woman is talking nicely to them that they're the only one talking to her - NOT THE CASE. The girl I am talking about was sleeping with 3-5 different men per day, and guys were treating her like she was some pure hearted gift.I will post this video eventually.

Original filename: it's more fucked in the philippines.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 42] We are still going to have National Parks after this... right?
item.description:
>Superintendent of Crater Lake National Park resigns due to untenable role and downsizing of the National Park Service
>says that he believes it's not possible to sustain the park at this rate

https://www.kgw.com/article/news/local/southern-oregon/crater-lake-superintendent-resigns-over-trump-admin-staffing-cuts/283-065723b6-1e60-409e-8a9d-bf8359b448f9

>Heatley criticized what he described as a systemic effort to shrink the Park Service workforce, pointing to early retirement incentives for veteran employees, and terminations of newer staff without clear cause. He said policies initiated under the Trump administration continue to erode the agency‚Äôs ability to function.

>‚ÄúWe‚Äôre being told, for instance, when people leave, they only want to replace 25% of those permanent positions,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt run an organization like that.‚Äù

We are still going to have the parks after this, r-right bros?

item.title: [291] /HGM/ homegrown men 404
item.description:
Weed control, mulching, no-till edition. I'm about to mulch my entire corn plot with wood chips to prevent any more weeds for the rest of the year. I really want to go no-till in the coming years, especially for corn if that is viable while controlling weeds effectively. Was very interested in this video on Mennonites who do no-till: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pICYSujSkGU&t=1148s
Tell me bros, is no-till viable with organic methods at scale? I grow around 1-2 acres of corn each year. I happen to have the wood chips to mulch this field from a family member who does wood work, they are from hardwoods.

pastebin:
https://pastebin.com/Mvfh8b87

New USDA zone map has been released: https://planthardiness.ars.usda.gov/

Koppen Climate Map: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/fb/K%C3%B6ppen_World_Map_High_Resolution.png

Search terms:
Agrarian, Agriculture, Agrology, Agronomy, Aquaculture, Aquaponics, Berkeley Method Hot Composting, Cold Frames, Companion Planting, Composting, Container Gardening, Core Gardening Method, Cultivation, Deep Water Culture (DWC), Dry Farming, Espalier, Farmer's Market, Forest Gardening, Forestry, Fungiculture, Geoponics, Greenhouses, Homesteading, Horticulture, Hot Boxes, H√ºgelkultur, Humanure, Hydroponic Dutch Bucket System, Hydroponics, Keyhole Garden, Korean Natural Farming, Kratky Method, Landscaping, Lasagna Gardening, Ley Farming, Market Garden, Mulching, No-till Method, Ollas Irrigation, Orchard, Permaculture, Polyculture, Polytunnels, Propagation, Rain Gutter Garden, Raised Beds, Ranch, Rooftop Gardening, Ruth Stout Garden, Sharecropping, City Slicker Composting, Shifting Cultivation, Soil-bag Gardening, Square Foot Gardening, Stale Seed Bed, Sugar Bush, Truck Farming, Vermiculture, Vertical Gardening, Window Frame Garden, Windrow Composting, Alpaca, Snail, Toad, Trumpeter, Turkey, Worm, biochar, vermicomposting

Original filename: IMG_7543.jpg

item.title: [ 45] Hey voyagers, The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread
item.description:
Hey voyagers,

The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread open for suggestions:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/trv/ is a slow board, so don't expect immediate responses. CHECK THE CATALOG ‚Äì you might find threads already discussing topics you're interested in.

Before asking for suggestions, tell /trv/ about your:
>Budget
>Interests
>Level of understanding of the local language(s)
This makes it easier to give quality advice. Of course, keep your posts travel related.

For all other matters:
General culture questions >>>/int/
Politics discussion >>>/pol/
Transportation discussion >>>/n/
Outdoors-related discussion >>>/out/

For more information about safety, planning and other miscellaneous topics, check out the pastebin:

GENERAL INFO:
https://pastebin.com/yR1SAr3s

Note: Discussions of prostitution or sex tourism are not permitted on /trv/.

Original filename: trv.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [126] 21 days at Malaysia
item.description:
I'm planning to visit the following places in June:

Kuala lumpur
Cameron highlands
George town
Perhentian
Medan (sumatra orangutans)

I arrive and depart from KL. Any recommendations to move from one place to the other, and in which order?
Going to Cameron Highlands seems like a pain in the ass since the bus is 3 to 4h are there better alternatives?
Better alternatives to Perhentian to dive? (not in Borneo)
Are Singapore or Melaka worth visiting?
Any other places worth visiting?
All tips welcome
